Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially black in section, the interior is covered with a thick dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and remains of at least three lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393366) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393366)
